question: What if you made a super cool video game about skateboarding unicorns, who would you want to play it?
Probably kids who love skateboarding and unicorns, duh!
Imagine you invented a delicious candy that tastes like pizza, who do you think would love to eat it?
I bet kids who love both pizza and candy would go crazy for it!
Picture yourself creating a comic book about a superhero dog who saves kittens, who would be the perfect readers for your comic?
Oh, I know! Kids who love dogs, superheroes, and cute kittens would love my comic!
Imagine you made a magical ice cream that changes flavors based on the person's favorite color. How would you group your customers?
I'd group them by their favorite colors, so they get their perfect ice cream flavor!
What if you started a cool club for kids who love dinosaurs and wanted to divide them into smaller groups? How would you do it?
I'd group them based on their favorite dinosaur types, like carnivores, herbivores, or flyers!
Picture yourself selling awesome skateboards to kids. How would you group your customers to make sure they get the perfect skateboard?
I'd group them based on their skateboarding skills, like beginners, intermediates, and experts!
Imagine you're a superhero who saves people based on the type of trouble they're in. How would you group the people you save?
I'd group them by the type of trouble, like people in danger from villains, accidents, or lost pets!
What if you invented a backpack that could turn invisible? What would make it special compared to other backpacks?
The invisibility feature, of course! No other backpacks can do that!
Imagine you created a pair of shoes that can make you jump super high. What would set them apart from regular shoes?
The super-jumping power! That's something regular shoes don't have!
Picture yourself making a robot that can do your homework for you. What makes it unique compared to other robots?
It can do my homework! No other robots can save me from boring homework!
What if you made a bike that could fly? What's special about it compared to other bikes?
The ability to fly, obviously! Regular bikes can only ride on the ground.
Imagine your favorite toy starts out as a new, exciting item, becomes popular, then slowly loses its appeal. What's happening to it?
It's going through a life cycle, just like how toys become popular and then get replaced by new ones!
What if a magical potion becomes a big hit, but over time, people find new potions and stop using it? What's going on with that potion?
The potion is going through its life cycle, from being new and popular to eventually fading away.
Picture a video game that starts as a small idea, gets popular, reaches its peak, and then slowly loses players. What's happening to it?
The game is going through its life cycle, from being a new game to eventually losing its popularity.

Imagine you made a team of superhero animals. What would you do to make them stand out and be recognized by everyone?
I'd give them a cool team name, matching costumes, and a catchy slogan so everyone knows who they are!
What if you started a club for kids who love space and wanted to make your club memorable? What would you create?
I'd design an awesome logo, choose special club colors, and come up with a fun club motto that's all about space!
Picture yourself opening a magical ice cream shop. How would you make your shop unique and recognizable?
I'd choose a catchy name, create a cool sign, and decorate the shop with magical ice cream-themed colors and designs!
Imagine you created a toy company that makes super-cool action figures. What would you do to make your company stand out?
I'd create a memorable logo, choose eye-catching colors, and develop a unique style for all the action figures and packaging!
If you wanted to create the most amazing board game ever, how would you find out what kids really want to play?
I'd ask kids what they like and dislike about other games and use their answers to make the best game possible!
Imagine you want to make the perfect candy. How would you find out what flavors kids love the most?
I'd do a taste test with different flavors and ask kids to rate their favorites, so I can create the yummiest candy ever!
What if you were planning a super-fun party for your friends? How would you find out what they'd enjoy the most?
I'd ask them about their favorite party games, snacks, and themes to make sure the party is a blast for everyone!
Picture yourself designing a new superhero toy. How would you find out what features kids would like the most?
I'd ask kids what they like about other superhero toys and use their ideas to create the ultimate superhero toy!
If you made a cool robot toy, what four things would you need to figure out to make it a big hit?
I'd need to decide what the robot does, how much it costs, where to sell it, and how to tell everyone about it!
Imagine you created a magical potion that grants wishes. What four factors would you need to consider to sell it successfully?
I'd think about the potion's effects, the price, where to sell it, and how to advertise it to people who want wishes granted!
What if you invented a super-fast skateboard? What four things would you need to plan to make sure kids go crazy for it?
I'd focus on the skateboard's features, the price, where kids can buy it, and how to spread the word about my awesome skateboard!
Picture yourself opening a bakery with the tastiest treats ever. What four things would you need to plan to make your bakery a success?
I'd concentrate on the types of treats I offer, how much they cost, where my bakery is located, and how to promote it so everyone knows about it!
Imagine you made a cool new video game and wanted to tell everyone about it online. What could you do?
I'd create a website, post about it on social media, and maybe even make some online ads to get the word out!
What if you opened an online store for your custom-made superhero costumes? How would you get people to find your store?
I'd use social media, email newsletters, and online ads to let people know about my awesome costumes!
Picture yourself starting a blog about the coolest toys and gadgets. How would you get people to read your blog?
I'd share my posts on social media, use email to update subscribers, and try to get my blog to show up in search engine results!
Imagine you created a new brand of magical candy and wanted to sell it online. How would you let people know about it?
I'd create a website, make fun social media posts, and run online ads to spread the word about my magical candy!
If you made a cool new toy and wanted to show it off on social media, what could you do?
I'd post fun pictures and videos of the toy in action, share exciting news, and maybe even have a giveaway for my followers!
What if you opened a skateboard shop and wanted to use social media to attract customers? What would you do?
I'd share awesome skateboard videos, post pictures of new products, and interact with my followers to get them excited about my shop!
Picture yourself starting a YouTube channel about your adventures as a time-traveling detective. How would you use social media to get more viewers?
I'd share sneak peeks of upcoming episodes, interact with my fans, and post behind-the-scenes content to keep them engaged!
Imagine you created a new comic book series and wanted to use social media to build a fanbase. What would you do?
I'd share previews of upcoming issues, post cool artwork, and have Q&A sessions with my fans to get them excited about my comic!
What if you were an expert in making amazing treehouses and wanted to use your skills to attract more customers? What could you do?
I'd create a blog with awesome treehouse-building tips and share my coolest projects to show people how great my treehouses are!
Imagine you were a talented young magician who wanted to gain more fans. How could you use your magic skills to do that?
I'd make fun and entertaining magic tutorial videos to teach people cool tricks and get them interested in my magic shows!
Picture yourself as a famous inventor who wants to inspire kids to be more creative. What could you do?
I'd create a website with fun DIY projects and stories about my inventions to get kids excited about being creative and inventive!
What if you were a skilled artist who wanted to share your love of painting with others? How would you use your talent to do that?
I'd create a YouTube channel with painting tutorials and tips to help people learn new techniques and enjoy the art of painting!
Imagine you have a website about the coolest video games, and you want it to show up when people search for video games online. What would you do?
I'd use SEO strategies like using the right keywords, creating great content, and getting other websites to link to mine!
What if you wrote a blog about amazing superhero movies and wanted more people to find it when they search online? What would you do?
I'd focus on SEO by using popular superhero-related keywords, writing engaging content, and making sure my site loads fast!
Picture yourself running an online store that sells magical toys. How would you make sure people find your store when they search for magical toys online?
I'd use SEO techniques like including magical toy keywords, creating interesting content, and making my website easy to navigate!
Imagine you created a new line of super cool action figures and wanted your website to be found when people search for action figures. What would you do?
I'd work on SEO by using the right action figure keywords, creating awesome content, and making sure my website is mobile-friendly!
What if you wanted to promote your new superhero comic book online and only pay when someone clicks on your ad? What could you do?
I'd use PPC advertising, like Google Ads or social media ads, where I only pay when someone clicks on my ad!
Imagine you created an online store selling magical candy and wanted to advertise it online but only pay when someone visits your store. What would you do?
I'd use PPC advertising, so I only pay when someone clicks on my ad and visits my magical candy store!
Picture yourself launching a new line of awesome skateboard designs and wanted to promote them online while only paying for actual visitors. What would you do?
I'd use PPC advertising to create online ads and only pay when someone clicks on my ad and checks out my skateboards!
What if you wanted to advertise your new video game online but only pay when someone actually visits your website? What would you do?
I'd use PPC advertising, like search engine or social media ads, to promote my game and only pay when someone clicks on my ad!
Imagine you started a club for kids who love space and wanted to keep them updated on club events and news. How could you do that?
I'd use email marketing to send them newsletters with the latest club news, events, and fun space facts!
What if you created a cool new toy and wanted to let your customers know about special offers and promotions? What would you do?
I'd use email marketing to send them updates about discounts, new products, and other exciting news related to my toy!
Picture yourself opening a bakery and wanting to keep your customers informed about new treats and special offers. How would you do that?
I'd use email marketing to send out newsletters with updates on new menu items, promotions, and bakery news!
Imagine you created an online course about learning magic tricks and wanted to keep your students engaged and informed. What would you do?
I'd use email marketing to send them regular updates, tips, and resources to help them learn and enjoy the magic course!
If you had a business selling amazing treehouses and wanted to keep track of your customers and their needs, what could you use?
I'd use a CRM system to manage customer information, track their preferences, and make sure I provide the best service possible!
What if you ran a magical ice cream shop and wanted to make sure you remember your customers' favorite flavors and preferences? What would you do?
I'd use a CRM system to store customer information, keep track of their favorite flavors, and help provide a personalized experience!
Picture yourself owning a popular toy store and wanting to keep track of your customers' purchases and preferences. What would you do?
I'd use a CRM system to manage customer data, track their buying habits, and ensure I provide excellent customer service!
Imagine you ran a successful online store for custom-made superhero costumes and wanted to manage your customer relationships effectively. What would you do?
I'd use a CRM system to store customer information, track their orders, and make sure I provide a great shopping experience!
What if you invented a new superhero gadget and wanted to make sure it gets a good reputation and positive coverage in the media? What would you do?
I'd work on public relations by sharing news about the gadget, giving interviews, and maybe even hosting a launch event!
Imagine you created a new type of magical potion and wanted to build a positive image for it in the public eye. How would you do that?
I'd focus on public relations, like telling stories about the potion's benefits, getting testimonials, and connecting with influencers who love it!
Picture yourself as a famous inventor who wants to maintain a positive reputation and share your achievements with the world. What would you do?
I'd work on public relations by giving interviews, sharing news about my inventions, and collaborating with others in the field!
What if you were a talented young magician who wanted to build a good reputation and get more fans? How could you achieve that?
I'd focus on public relations, like performing at charity events, giving interviews, and sharing my magic on social media!
If you opened a store selling custom-made wizard robes, how would you decide which groups of people to target?
I'd divide the market into segments based on age, interests, and locations where wizard fans live, and then target those who'd be most interested in my robes!
What if you created a new type of candy that changes flavor every time you chew it? How would you decide who to sell it to?
I'd segment the market based on factors like age, taste preferences, and locations with lots of candy lovers, then focus on the segments most likely to enjoy my candy!
Imagine you invented a flying skateboard. How would you decide which people to market it to?
I'd break the market into segments based on age, interests in skateboarding and flying, and locations with lots of skateboarders, then target the groups most likely to buy my flying skateboard!
If you made a line of superhero action figures that could talk, what would make them stand out from other action figures?
Their ability to talk and interact with kids would be my USP, making them unique and more appealing than regular action figures!
What if you created a new type of ice cream that never melts? What would make it different from other ice creams?
The fact that it never melts would be my USP, setting my ice cream apart from others and making it a must-try treat!
Imagine you invented a new kind of bicycle that could transform into a scooter. What would make it special compared to other bicycles?
The transforming feature would be my USP, making my bicycle-scooter combo unique and more versatile than regular bicycles!
What if you created a new type of video game console? How would its popularity change over time?
introduction when it's new, growth as it gains popularity, maturity when it's most popular, and decline as newer consoles come out!
Imagine you started selling a new type of colorful, bouncy ball. How would its sales change from the time it's introduced to when it's no longer popular?
introduction with low sales, growth as it becomes popular, maturity with stable sales, and decline as people lose interest!
What if you opened a store selling futuristic hoverboards? How would their sales change from the time they're first introduced to when they're no longer the latest trend?
introduction with low sales, growth as they gain popularity, maturity when sales stabilize, and decline as newer trends emerge!
If you opened a magical candy store, what would you do to create a unique and memorable brand for your store?
I'd choose a catchy name, create a colorful and magical logo, and develop a consistent style and messaging that reflects the magic of my candy!
Imagine you started a company that makes eco-friendly superhero toys. How would you build a unique brand around your products?
I'd come up with a name that highlights the eco-friendly aspect, design a logo that shows our commitment to the environment, and use consistent messaging to promote our values and mission!
What if you created a new type of skateboard that could ride on water? How would you create a memorable brand for your invention?
I'd pick a cool name that reflects the unique feature, design an eye-catching logo related to water and skateboarding, and use consistent colors and messaging to make my brand stand out!
If you invented a new type of magical potion, how would you decide on the right product, price, place, and promotion for it?
I'd create a unique potion with cool effects, set a price based on its value and competitors, choose places where magic fans shop, and use creative promotions to spread the word!
options: Marketing mix (4 Ps of marketing) (correct answer)

question: Imagine you designed a new line of robot pets. How would you consider the 4 Ps of marketing to make sure they're successful?
I'd create fun and interactive robot pets, set a competitive price, sell them in stores and online where pet lovers shop, and promote them through ads and events!
options: Marketing mix (4 Ps of marketing) (correct answer)

question: What if you started a business selling custom superhero costumes? How would you use the 4 Ps of marketing to make your business a success?
I'd create high-quality, personalized costumes, set a fair price based on the customization, sell them through my online store, and promote my business through social media and events!
options: Marketing mix (4 Ps of marketing) (correct answer)
